meanings.definition: A person or thing that flings.
meanings.sent1: The baseball player was known as a skilled flinger on the team.
meanings.sent2: The flinger tossed the ball with great accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The little monkey was a mischievous flinger of bananas at the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a flinger of truth, piercing through the lies.
meanings.sent5: The flinger of confetti made the party even more festive.

meanings.definition: One who throws or hurls something.
meanings.sent1: The flinger in the competition had a strong arm.
meanings.sent2: The baseball pitcher is a skilled flinger of fastballs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was a flinger of snowballs at passing cars.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a flinger of joy into the room.
meanings.sent5: The flinger of insults hurt others with his words.

meanings.definition: A projecting part on a machine for throwing off chips, sparks, etc.
meanings.sent1: The metal lathe had a flinger to prevent debris from flying.
meanings.sent2: The flinger on the grinder helped keep the workspace clean.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning flinger caused sparks to scatter everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The flinger on the engine worked like a shield, protecting the workers.
meanings.sent5: The flinger on the saw ensured safety by directing wood chips away from the operator.
